item.description:
Consisting of 4,234.4 acres of rolling woodland meadows and streams, 1800 acres of which has been designated as a National Natural Landmark, the Refuge is open to the public year round. Passive recreation and the study of flora and fauna are encouraged. The Refuge is maintained with a limited endowment from the McLean Fund. There is no admission charge for public use.

Main Entrance to the Game Refuge

From points to the south (Simsbury, Avon, Farmington)
Travel north on Route 10/202. The Game Refuge will be on your left approximately one mile south of Granby center.

From points to the north (Southwick, Westfield)
Travel south on Route 10/202. The Game Refuge will be on your right approximately one mile south of Granby Center.

From Route 91 (north or south bound)
Take exit 40 (Bradley International Airport). Follow the signs for East Granby/Granby (Route 20 west). At the traffic light in Granby center, turn left (south) on Route 10/202. The Game Refuge will be on your right approximately one mile south of Granby center.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be with Carly, my Irish Setter, in the parking lot.
item.why: To enjoy the beauty of nature, and meet new folks.
item.name: McLean Game Refuge Hike
